abstract: Barely a month into Meg Whitman's tenure as chief executive, Hewlett-Packard announced Thursday that it would not sell the company's dominant personal computer business - rejecting a decision made by her predecessor.
snippet: Barely a month into Meg Whitman's tenure as chief executive, Hewlett-Packard announced Thursday that it would not sell the company's dominant personal computer business - rejecting a decision made by her predecessor.
lead_paragraph: Barely a month into Meg Whitman's tenure as chief executive, Hewlett-Packard announced Thursday that it would not sell the company's dominant personal computer business - closing off a strategic path offered by her predecessor, Bits reports. Read more »

headline.main: Hewlett-Packard to Keep Its PC Business
